newsitem.title: INDIA: INDIA SUGAR RANGED ON LOW SUPPLIES, LACK OF BUYING.
newsitem.headline: INDIA SUGAR RANGED ON LOW SUPPLIES, LACK OF BUYING.

text.p: Indian sugar ended Wednesday steady following range-bound trade on limited offerings despite lower than expected consumer demand ahead of the festival season, dealers said.
In the ready delivery sugar S-30 was quiet at 1,490/1,515 rupees per quintal as was sugar M-30 at 1,520/1,542 rupees per quintal.
"Arrivals of sugar from mills to the market remained low due to limited offerings by millers," one broker said.
"Local millers have already sold out their allotted quantity of free sale sugar for the first half of the current month," he added.
The free sale quota for August is 750,000 tonnes, the same as that for July. The June quota was 800,000 tonnes.
